topic.title: HP Helion Openstack Carrier Grade (Beta): Configuring VXLAN Endpoint IP Addresses

titlealts.searchtitle: HP Helion Openstack Carrier Grade (Beta): Configuring VXLAN Endpoint IP Addresses

body.p: You can configure a data interface on a compute node with an endpoint address using CLI commands.
Note: This feature applies only to servers in the VNF Region.
For VXLAN connectivity between VMs, the compute nodes that host the VMs must be configured with endpoint IP addresses.

ol.li:
Lock the compute node first.
system host-lock hostname
where hostname is the name of the compute node host

Set the interface to support an IPv4 or IPv6 address, or both.system host-if-modify node ifname --ipv4-mode=ipv4mode --ipv6-mode=ipv6mode
where
node is the name or UUID of the compute node
ifname is the name of the interface
ipv4mode is either disabled or static
ipv6mode is either disabled or static

Add an IPv4 or IPv6 address to the interface.
system host-addr-add node ifname ip_address prefix
where
node is the name or UUID of the compute node
ifname is the name of the interface
ip_address is an IPv4 or IPv6 address
prefix is the netmask length for the address
To delete an address, use the following commands:system host-addr-list
This displays the UUIDs of existing addresses.system host-addr-delete uuid
where uuid is the UUID of the address.

Unlock the compute node and wait for it to become available.
system host-unlock hostname
where hostname is the name of the compute node host

body.p: To delete routes, use the following command.
system host-route-delete uuid ifname network prefix gateway metric

codeblock.codeph:
where
* `uuid` is the UUID of the route to be deleted. * `node` is the name or UUID of the compute node * `ifname` is the name of the interface * `network` is an IPv4 or IPv6 network address * `prefix` is the netmask length for the network address * `gateway` is the default gateway * `metric` is the cost of the route (the number of hops)
